    • Method Detail

      • getBagOfWords

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getBagOfWords(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> categories,
                                                                              java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> stars,
                                                                              java.lang.Integer maxNumberOfReviewToUse)
        This function will query the database to get a collection reviews based on the given input parameters. Then will count the words in these reviews to produce a bag of words for the collection.

        Note: Selecting all 2.2 million review by leaving categories, and stars empty and maxNumberOfReviewToUse to 0 is not a good idea and will take long time to process.

        Parameters:
        categories - A set of categories(strings) which all reviews will share. Note call getSetOfCatagories to get list of available categories. Pass in either null or empty set to select all categories
        stars - A set of star ratings(integers) which all reviews will have been rated.For example pass in {1,2} to get only review that have been rated with 1 or 2 stars.
        maxNumberOfReviewToUse - The max number of review to use in bag of words(0 for no limit)
        Returns:
        A Map representation of a Bag of words (word-:Frequency of word)

      • getBagOfWordsNormilaized

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getBagOfWordsNormilaized(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> categories,
                                                                                        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> stars,
                                                                                        java.lang.Integer maxNumberOfReviewToUse)
        This function will query the database to get a collection reviews based on the given input parameters. Then will count the words in these reviews to produce a bag of words for the collection normalized. All entries in map should add up to ~1(may be slightly off due to rounding errors).

        Note: Selecting all 2.2 million review by leaving categories, and stars empty and maxNumberOfReviewToUse to 0 is not a good idea and will take long time to process.

        Parameters:
        categories - A set of categories(strings) which all reviews will share. Note call getSetOfCatagories to get list of available categories. Pass in either null or empty set to select all categories
        stars - A set of star ratings(integers) which all reviews will have been rated.For example pass in {1,2} to get only review that have been rated with 1 or 2 stars.
        maxNumberOfReviewToUse - The max number of review to use in bag of words(0 for no limit)
        Returns:
        A Map representation of a Bag of words (word-:percentage word appeared in collection)

      • getSetOfReviews

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSetOfReviews(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> categories,
                                                              java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> stars,
                                                              java.lang.Integer maxNumberOfReviewToUse)
        This function will query the database to return a collection reviews based on the given input parameters.

        Note: Selecting all 2.2 million review by leaving categories, and stars empty and maxNumberOfReviewToUse to 0 is not a good idea and will take long time to process.

        Parameters:
        categories - A set of categories(strings) which all reviews will share. Note call getSetOfCatagories to get list of available categories. Pass in either null or empty set to select all categories
        stars - A set of star ratings(integers) which all reviews will have been rated.For example pass in {1,2} to get only review that have been rated with 1 or 2 stars.
        maxNumberOfReviewToUse - The max number of review to use in bag of words(0 for no limit)
        Returns:
        A set of reviews

      • getSetOfReviews

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSetOfReviews(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> categories,
                                                              java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> stars,
                                                              java.lang.Integer start,
                                                              java.lang.Integer end)
        This function will query the database to return a collection reviews based on the given input parameters.

        Note: Selecting all 2.2 million review by leaving categories, and stars empty and start and stop to 0 is not a good idea and will take long time to process.

        Parameters:
        categories - A set of categories(strings) which all reviews will share. Note call getSetOfCatagories to get list of available categories. Pass in either null or empty set to select all categories
        stars - A set of star ratings(integers) which all reviews will have been rated.For example pass in {1,2} to get only review that have been rated with 1 or 2 stars.
        start - The max number of review to use in bag of words(0 for no limit)
        end - The max number of review to use in bag of words(0 for no limit)
        Returns:
        A set of reviews

      • getSetOfCatagories

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSetOfCatagories(int numberOfCategories)
        Query the database for set of most occurring categories.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCategories - The number of category label you wish to see.
        Returns:
        a Set of category labels
